alert.note: Alert for Kern (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 20 at 12:03PM PDT until August 20 at 3:15PM PDT by NWS Hanford
info.description: The National Weather Service in Hanford has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Kern County in central California... * Until 315 PM PDT. * At 1203 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain across the warned area. Between 0.2 and 0.3 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Heavy rain producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Mojave. This includes the following streams and drainages... Oak Creek and Cache Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
